channel.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
channel.description:
ActorDefinition: http://pastebin.com/yuEFhsYN
ActorDefinitionParser: http://pastebin.com/J8p54HHr
edit: had to upload to pastebin due to 20,000 character limit

item.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
item.dc:creator: @blackflag1 blackflag_
item.description:
@blackflag1 wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:6, topic:508507”][quote author=Cyberus link=topic=626746.msg4261099#msg4261099 date=1363468086]
that’s why i called it actor; in the client (i made this for my cache editor) players use the definition as well.
[/quote]

Like I told you on r-s (and still waiting for the reply). Where do you see players having (or why would they even have) definitions?

The only thing I can think of is IDK, which I repeat, has nothing to do with “player definition”.

This is just NPCDefinitions.[/quote]

He also mentiond on r-s that it’s for his cache editor

Read full topic

item.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Cyberus, post:9, topic:508507”]you said “I would rather have GameObject than Object because of the confusion it could inflict on others…” i agreed and said i rather have that as well. i named it this for the same reason, so it doesn’t conflict.

you didn’t mention naming? same quote from above. i clearly justified it several times and Cups did as well in the shoutbox, re read if you must

obviously

i just talked about this

again, several times, re read

you checked up and posted the exact same thing here.[/quote]

I’m posting on r-s, since I don’t want to go around just c&p’ing arguments.

Read full topic

item.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

you said “I would rather have GameObject than Object because of the confusion it could inflict on others…” i agreed and said i rather have that as well. i named it this for the same reason, so it doesn’t conflict.

you didn’t mention naming? same quote from above. i clearly justified it several times and Cups did as well in the shoutbox, re read if you must

obviously

i just talked about this

again, several times, re read

you checked up and posted the exact same thing here.

Read full topic

item.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“Cyberus, post:7, topic:508507”]and like i said on r-s:
i would rather have that as well, hence why i named it actor instead of character because it could conflict.[/quote]

  • What does that have to do with what I said on r-s?

  • I do not understand what you’re getting at in all honesty…Please think thoroughly before posting.
    I think you’re arguing about the naming; I did not mention the naming on my post, but now that you mention it, it’s a bad name.

Cyberus:

they are both actors (or game characters for you and entities for luke) and they both make use of the definition, that’s why i named it what i did. i honestly don’t recall what the player uses the definition for but if it’s just something like masking i can see why people would prefer for this to be called npc definition but i think the reason why i represent players and npcs as actors is justified

Both entity and game characters are correct, but entity would be the superclass in this case.

Like I said before, there is no “player definitions”.

If you’re saying it’s justified, but you’re not justifying it, how is it justified?

Cyberus:

did you seriously come out of your way to argue here too?

No…I check up on mopar from time-to-time, don’t be so egocentric.

Read full topic

item.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

[quote=“relexlawl, post:6, topic:508507”][quote author=Cyberus link=topic=626746.msg4261099#msg4261099 date=1363468086]
that’s why i called it actor; in the client (i made this for my cache editor) players use the definition as well.
[/quote]

Like I told you on r-s (and still waiting for the reply). Where do you see players having (or why would they even have) definitions?

The only thing I can think of is IDK, which I repeat, has nothing to do with “player definition”.

This is just NPCDefinitions.[/quote]
and like i said on r-s:
i would rather have that as well, hence why i named it actor instead of character because it could conflict.

they are both actors (or game characters for you and entities for luke) and they both make use of the definition, that’s why i named it what i did. i honestly don’t recall what the player uses the definition for but if it’s just something like masking i can see why people would prefer for this to be called npc definition but i think the reason why i represent players and npcs as actors is justified

did you seriously come out of your way to argue here too?

Read full topic

item.title: Apollo actor definition parsing
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Cyberus:

that’s why i called it actor; in the client (i made this for my cache editor) players use the definition as well.

The player can mask itself as an NPC, but that doesn’t qualify it to be the generic base class
